60’s, female, eccentric, devious, wheeler-dealer
20’s, male, Talbar’s gormless assistant and minder
SALAVATORI 40s’, female, impossibly glamorous mercenary
SORSHA 70’s, male, embittered arch-villain
ALIONA/JANDOR: KIRSTY BESTERMAN 20's, female, compassionate Princess with a tough centre
WEBSTER 50’s, male, a starship captain, in Lord Nelson mould
DERVISH 20’s, female, the one on the bridge who does the steering
140’s, alien bar owner with strange accent
WRATH/WRATH LEADER/WRATH EMPEROR Robotized zombie Igris, gravelly, brutish voices.
One of the crew of the HMS Trafalgar who has a bad day.

KEN BENTLEY
ALAN BARNES PRODUCER: DAVID RICHARDSON
TOBY HRYCEK-ROBINSON
NICHOLAS BRIGGS & JASON HAIGH-ELLERY

THE SHADOW HEART — by Jonathan Morris Page 3
EPISODE ONE
OPENING THEME
1: INT. STARBAFF’S BAR
(FX: THE ENTRANCE OF A BAR. MUFFLED NOISE FROM WITHIN.
ZOOMS PAST OUTSIDE, FLYING CARS. IT’S RAINING.
THE BAR LANDLORD, STARBAFF, IS DEALING WITH A DIFFICULT CUSTOMER. STARBAFF HAS A NON-SPECIFIC EASTERN ACCENT — ‘MARION’ OUT OF ‘MONGRELS’. THE CUSTOMER IS AN ALIEN
THAT SPEAKS WITH A MIXTURE OF GURGLES AND GRUNTS
SOUND LIKE SERBO-CROAT )
I ask you, what sort of business you think I am running here? This is respectable establishment.
FX: TOSCIRIL PROTESTS
I no care. Can you no read sign? (READ) No weapon in bar. You want fight, you go down road to Pandarock’s Pleasure Emporium.
FX: TOSCIRIL ANGRY

I no care if it Sorshan longbow belonging to Prince Kylo himself, no weapon in bar! It bad enough having the Wrath burst in and massacre the place twenty year ago without you performing re-enactment! Either you stick weapon in security basket or you take custom elsewhere!
FX: TOSCIRIL SWEARS AND LEAVES
And same to you. And your mother! (BEAT) Honestly, this planet going right downhill. The criminal element, they will send me to early grave!
(FX: STARBAFF ENTERS BAR THROUGH SWINGING DOORS. WE MOVE WITH HIM. SOUNDS OF BAR LOUDER — LOTS OF CHATTER. ALIENS OF ALL KINDS. SOME HAVE VOICE-EFFECTS AND WEIRD ACCENTS,
MAKE UNINTELLIGIBLE WHOOPS, SNARLS, CHITTERS AND QUACKS. PLUS ROBOTS BLEEPING AND WHIRRING.
THE SOUND OF THE BAR BAND GETS LOUDER. AN ALIEN FORM OF PROHIBITION-ERA JAZZ)
THE SHADOW HEART — by Jonathan Morris Page 4
Excuse me, excuse me... hello, is anyone serving you? Jorbinda, serve these gentlemen. What you think I pay you for girl, to stand around looking like big cactus plant?
(FX: JORBINDA TAKES ORDER. WE APPROACH BAR, PINTS BEING POURED, CUSTOMERS TRYING TO GET ATTENTION. BAND LOUDER)
Excuse me, you no going to get serve if I cannot get to bar... thankyouverymuch.
FX: HE GETS BEHIND BAR
Okay. Who first?
A Frostil shandy, a Bachelor’s Nitrate and a Temperance
Sunrise.
Come right up! (SINGING) Frostil shandy, frostil shandy —
FX: DRINKS BEING POURED
Oh and Talbar says, can she have some Mud-fruit in her
Temperance Sunrise?
Mud-fruit, no problem. There you go. Fourteen forty five.
(COUNTS OUT) Fifteen, keep the change.
Thankyou, you are fountain of generosity. Next please!
(FX: HORVAL TAKES THE DRINKS AND MOVES THROUGH CROWDS. WE MOVE WITH HIM AWAY FROM BAR AND BAND)
Excuse me, man with drinks coming through...
FX: HE REACHES A QUIET NOOK
There you go. One for me, Temperance Sunrise for Talbar,
and a Bachelor’s Nitrate for Mister Grewchaw.
FX: GREWCHAW MAKES A GURGLING, GULPING NOISE
THE SHADOW HEART — by Jonathan Morris Page 5
Aw, sorry, forgot about the blood-nuts.
Well you can just pop yourself back to the bar and get some, Horval!
But Talbar -
Mister Grewchaw and myself are in the middle of discussing important business and if blood-nuts are requested then blood-nuts we shall provide.
Alright, I’m going, I’m going.
FX: HORVAL LEAVES. GREWCHAW SLURPS DRINK
Now, where were we? Oh yes. You were about to make me an offer, weren’t you?
FX: GREWCHAW REPLIES
(LAUGHS) No, but seriously. We’re talking ten megaweight of Galdrium here!
FX: GREWCHAW REPLIES
Alright, yes, it is scrap metal, but you’re still not going to get a better price this side of Cawdor.
FX: GREWCHAW REPLIES
Where did I find it? You think I’m going to tell you that, so you can go there and pick it up yourself?
FX: GREWCHAW REPLIES
Well, if you’re not interested, there’s plenty of others out there who are. I hear Ludo Joyce is on the lookout
for Galdrium for his new astro-dome.
FX: GREWCHAW REPLIES
THE SHADOW HEART — by Jonathan Morris Page 6
Alright... As you’re an old friend, I can go down to nine hundred, and I’m literally cutting my own throat.
FX: GREWCHAW REPLIES
Done! Pleasure doing business with you, Mister Grewchaw. I’ll drop off the goods at your place at first zenith and you can pay me then. Until then. Have a good night!
FX: GREWCHAW REPLIES AND THEN LEAVES
(QUIETLY) Oh well. Better than nothing, I suppose -
FX: HORVAL RETURNS
I got the blood-nuts. Hey, where did the fat seaweed bloke go?
Don’t talk about Mister Grewchaw like that, he might still be able to hear you and then the next thing you’d know he’1l be puncturing your neck with his venom glands.
Alright, keep your wig on. So, how much did we get?
Eight-fifty.
Eight-fifty? Is that all? You said we’d get at least a grand.
That’s the trouble with having the Wrath Empire sniffing about on your doorstep, it makes people nervous —
(FX: TALBAR IS INTERRUPTED BY SOUND OF TARDIS BEGINNING TO LAND. CONSTERNATION IN THE BAR)
(DISTANT)
Hey! What you doing! No unauthorise materializations! This is respectable establishment — (CONTINUES IN B/G)
FX: DURING THIS TARDIS CONTINUES TO LAND
What’s going on? I can’t see.
THE SHADOW HEART — by Jonathan Morris Page 7
It’s some kind of a blue hut, like one of them Gadarel Confession Booths we got saddled with a couple of annum back.
(FX: TARDIS FINISHES LANDING. TARDIS DOOR OPENS.
REACT WITH SURPRISE AND CONCERN )
Someone’s coming out. A little fella.
Hey, you! What you think you doing! Starbaff’s is not municipal storage depot!
Oh great-creator, he’s coming this way.
FX: DOCTOR STAGGERS OVER TO THEM THROUGH CROWD
Please... You have... to help... me.
FX: DOCTOR COLLAPSES, KNOCKING OVER TABLE
I think he’s spilled your Temperance Sunrise, Talbar.
(REACTS) Blimey! Some sort of laser blast, right in the chest... I’m surprised he’s not dead.
Not far off it, though. He’s still smouldering.
Yes. But if he’s got his own personal transmat capsule, he can’t be short of a credit or two.
Talbar, what are you saying?
Just thinking aloud, Horval. Just thinking aloud!
FX: STARBAFF HAS MADE HIS WAY OVER TO THEM
Alright, you on floor, you can hop-skip right back into your box and dematerialize back way you came!
THE SHADOW HEART — by Jonathan Morris Page 8
I don’t think he’s going to answer you, he’s out cold. Apart from the bits of him that are still on fire.
Well that not my problem. He is unauthorise interloper.
It’s alright, Starbaff, we’1ll look after him.
What? He with you? I thought as much! He just your sort!
We were on our way out anyway, we’ll take him with us.
What about hello big blue box in middle of my bar?
We'll come back for it later. Horval, can you help me carry him?
I’m not sure this is a good idea, Talbar.
Have I ever led you into trouble?
Yeah. In fact, I can’t really remember you ever leading me anywhere else.
Well this time will be different. You take his legs. One. Two. Lift!
FX: THEY LIFT THE DOCTOR
GROANS, UNCONSCIOUS
Alright. But when he wake up, you tell him. He barred! He not allowed come back to Starbaff’s, not today, not ever!
THE SHADOW HEART — by Jonathan Morris Page 9
2. EXT. STREET
(FX: A STREET NEAR THE BAR, SOUNDS SIMILAR TO OPENING OF SCENE 1. CARS ZOOM PAST, HORNS BLAST, SIRENS. RAINING.
APPROACH AND A PHONE BLEEPS. IT’S ANSWERED BY
SALVATORI. WE CAN MAKE OUT THE VOICE OF AN ALIEN
COD-ALBANIAN BETWEEN HER LINES)

Hello, yes? () I might, why do you ask? () A blue box, made of wood, about the size of a safety crate. () What did he look like? He was injured? Who took him? () Okay, I’m on my way. () Yes, you’ll get your reward, fifty credits.
FX: PHONE IS HUNG UP
So. The Doctor’s returned at last... (BEAT) Taxi-pod!
(FX: A HOVER-TAXI PULLS UP. IT’S DRIVEN BY A ROBOT THAT
QUESTIONINGLY )
Take me to Sharbell’s on Grip Street —
(FX: ROBOT BLEEPS AFFIRMATIVELY, SHE GETS IN, THEY DRIVE OFF)
THE SHADOW HEART — by Jonathan Morris Page 10
3. INT. TALBAR’S POD
(FX: TRAFFIC ON TEMPERANCE, OUT OF WHICH EMERGES A POD- CAR WITH AN UNHEALTHY GRINDING ENGINE, GEARS CRUNCHING,
RATTLING.
INSIDE, THE DOCTOR IS BEING ATTENDED BY A MEDI-ROBOT)
And what are we going to do when Mister Grewchaw finds out we've sold him a load of hulks full of comet-ice?
Don’t worry, everything will be ticketty-boo.
That’s what you said when we were caught with that load of hooky neutron drives, we nearly ended up doing a ten- year stretch in a prison mine.
But we didn’t, did we? We got away without a scratch.
Only because you bribed the Customs Inspector with those everlasting-life pills. I don’t think Mister Grewchaw is going to fall for that one again. He’s going to have our brachials for braces.
No, he won’t. That scrap was still forty per cent Galdrium, he’s got it at a good price and he knows it.
GROANS AS HE WAKES
You alright, old chap? Bit of a nasty chest wound you had there. Was touch and go for a minute.
Where... where am I?
You're in the back of our transit-pod.
Which planet?
Which planet? Temperance. Temperance Seven.
THE SHADOW HEART — by Jonathan Morris Page 11
(REMEMBERS) Which means you must be... Talbar and Horval?
Yes. How come you know who we are?
I was looking for you. You took quite a bit of finding.
Yes, well, we don’t tend to advertise our presence, it’s better to stay incognito in our line of business. You haven’t answered my question. How do you know who we are?
You were... recommended to me.
Recommended? Recommended for what?
To save my life.
Think nothing of it. You have the medibot to thank for the surgeo-graft.
Oh.
Although, of course, if it wasn’t for us you wouldn’t have been seen by a medibot, so feel free to make any spontaneous financial demonstrations of gratitude that you feel appropriate.
Ah. I’m afraid I don’t carry any currency —
What? Horval, get ready to eject him over the next refuse
pipe.
FX: BUTTONS PRESSED
- but I can assure you I am worth a great deal of money!
Horval, hold off a nano. (BEAT) You are?
FX: BUTTONS PRESSED
THE SHADOW HEART — by Jonathan Morris Page 12
To certain individuals. You might say I have a price on my head.
Who are these individuals and what are their contact numbers?
There is one individual in particular. I wonder if you might help me look for her.
Her?
Who is she? What’s her name?
Her name is —
THE SHADOW HEART — by Jonathan Morris Page 13
4. INT. STARBAFF’S BAR.
(FX: THE BAR IS EMPTIED, MUFFLED TRAFFIC/RAIN OUTSIDE.
IS SWEEPING UP)
Vienna Salvatori.
Sorry, lady-madam. Never heard of you.
And do you know why that is?
No, why?
FX: GUN POWERED UP. STARBAFF STOPS SWEEPING
Because I’m a professional killer and nobody who hears my name ever lives to tell the tale.
What? But I hope you are willing to make generous exception in my case?
That depends. On how helpful you are.
I am very helpful. People always say, “Starbaff, he very helpful guy. You looking for helpful guy, go to Starbaff, no-one else in town more helpful.”
So let’s put it to the test. One of your customers told me you had an “arrival” here earlier this evening.
Yes, there was unauthorise materialisation, most vexatious. Blue box turn up in middle of my bar making noise like angry Heftiphant.
Where is this box now?
I have it moved out back, it was blocking way to ladies’ lavatory.
THE SHADOW HEART — by Jonathan Morris Page 14
And did anyone emerge from this box?
Yes, little fellow, in bad way, staggering about.
Where is this man now?
He was taken away by Talbar and Horval, two snailers, they come in every now and then.
And where might I find them?
I think they staying in the Spotel Alendra, on outer fifth street.
Thank you. You were right. You’ve been very helpful.
So now you leave me, go bye-bye?
Ah, I would, but the problem is, I’ve told you my name.
Ah, but I no good with names. Who are you? I have no idea. Anyone ask me, we never met before in my life.
Nice try. But not good enough.
No... this is respectable...
FX: GUN FIRES
-.. establishment... (DIES)
FX: STARBAFF’S BODY SLUMPS TO THE FLOOR
THE SHADOW HEART — by Jonathan Morris Page 15
5. INT. SPOTEL ROOM.
FX: THE SPOTEL IS A SPACE PORT MOTEL. JAZZ MUZAK
In here, Doctor.
(FX: DOOR OPENED WITH KEY CARD. THEY ENTER, MUZAK FADES,
CLOSES. WHIRRING FAN AIR CONDITIONING)
Not exactly five stars, is it?
What did you expect, the Palladium Rosa? It’s cheap and convenient for the space port.
Yes. It’s obviously very popular. Mainly with insects of the order Blatteria.
I wouldn’t worry, they won’t bite unless you annoy them.
That’s very reassuring.
You’1l have to sleep in the chair, I’m afraid. I have to have the bed because of my bad back.
What about me?
You can have the bath, few blankets, you’1l be as snug as a snortis on Vortis. (BEAT) Now, how does this covey- machine work?
FX: TALBAR STARTS FILLING, SWITCHING ON COFFEE MACHINE
What is it that you two do, if you don’t mind me asking?
Bit of everything. You name it. Freight, asteroid mining. For the last ten annum we’ve been in the snailing game.
Snailing?
THE SHADOW HEART — by Jonathan Morris Page 16
We’re snailers.
And what are “sSnailers”?
You don’t know much, do you? It means we travel around in a Stellar Ammonite, salvaging wrecks.
A Stellar Ammonite?
A space snail, to use laymen’s terms. Ours is about the size of a lunar shuttle. His name’s Hercules.
Of course.
You’11 see him in the morning. Fastest gastropod in the Leevar cluster.
The quickest way around the galaxy is on the back of a snail?
Not on the back. That’d be ridiculous. We’ve a control cabin implanted in his stomach, like normal. We access it via a catheter hatch.
And you use this... stellar ammonite to collect wreckage?
FX: COFFEE MACHINE FINISHES
Yes, pretty much... So who wants covey? Doctor, how do you take it, blue or green?
As it comes.
FX: TALBAR POURS DRINKS, CONSUMED OVER THE NEXT PAGE
We travel to battlegrounds from the Wrath War, search through the derelicts, and then tow away what we find in Hercules’ electro-magnetic slipstream.
THE SHADOW HEART — by Jonathan Morris Page 17
It’s called a snail-trail. You should see it, it shines like a diamond chandelier.
I see. So you’re kind of intergalactic salvage men.
If you like, but our main market’s Galdrium rather than textiles or skeletal tissue.
(DRINKS) Interesting. So how long ago was the Wrath war?
Don’t know, must be getting on for fifty annum.
What happened, exactly?

Not sure. According to my father, the Wrath were fighting the Drashani when suddenly this change came over them. Overnight they were transformed from a load of zombie- drones into judgement machines. He said it was like somebody had pressed a big switch.
(QUIET) Yes, I remember. (NORMAL) So what happened next?

Well, to begin with, they were like guardian angels. But before we knew where we were they were more like avenging angels. They’d come across a planet they considered unjust and just... take it over like an invading army.
(QUIET) Programmed to uphold the rule of law, no matter what.
Our only hope is that the other lot, the human empire, defeat them before we’re all under their digits.
But that isn’t the worst of it.
It isn’t?
THE SHADOW HEART — by Jonathan Morris Page 18
There are stories, Doctor. Rumours. That when they take over these worlds... they also take away people.
What for?
Experimentation? Souvenirs? No-one knows.
Where do they take them?
Back to the Wrath homeworld. Place they call The Shadow Heart.
(MUSING) The Shadow Heart...
FX: SCUTTLING OF INSECTS
Did you hear that?
The wall-roaches, something’s disturbed them.
Can’t you smell it? A morphotic catalyst. Someone is pumping sleeping gas into the ventilation system.
I didn’t even know the ventilation system was working.
But who’s doing it? Doctor?
Look outside.
(FX: AS HE SPEAKS, WE HEAR A HELICOPTER-LIKE SOUND FROM OUTSIDE THE BUILDING, GETTING LOUDER AS IT APPROACHES )
A hovercopter!
Armed with laser harpoons. Get out of here, both of you.
What?
THE SHADOW HEART — by Jonathan Morris Page 19
Oh no, Doctor. You’re valuable merchandise. We’re not leaving you behind. (BEGINS COUGHING DUE TO GAS)
Listen to me. The bounty hunter piloting that hovercopter
wants me alive, but she will think nothing of killing you. Go!
FX: HARPOON FIRED. WINDOW SMASHES
(COUGHING) But what about the sleeping gas? We’1ll never get out of the spotel!
Once she’s got me, she won’t bother with you. I hope.
FX: ANOTHER HARPOON FIRED. WINDOW SMASHES
If you say so, Doctor. Good luck!
FX: THEY LEAVE
LOUD) It’s alright, Vienna. You’ve found me. (COUGHS
(VIA TANNOY ) Move towards the window. (BEAT) That’s it. One more step.
(COUGHING, LOSING CONSCIOUSNESS) One more step? Oh, I see... I have to be in range of your grappling arm.
(VIA TANNOY ) I advise you not to struggle. I’d hate to drop you from this height.
Struggle? I can barely keep my eyes... (FALLS ASLEEP)
FX: DOCTOR PICKED UP BY ARM DURING END OF THIS LINE
THE SHADOW HEART — by Jonathan Morris Page 20
6. INT. VIENNA’S SPACESHIP’S LIVING QUARTERS.
(FX: BLEEPING B/G EFFECTS, DISTINCTIVE HUM. DOCTOR IS STRAPPED TO A TABLE, CONNECTED TO A MIND PROBE DEVICE)
Alright. Time you woke up.
FX: DEVICE SETTING CHANGED
(WAKING) Where am I — oh, Miss Salvatori! This must be your spaceship, I presume? You wouldn’t happen to have made me a cup of tea by any chance?
No.
Oh. It’d be quite tricky to drink it, strapped to this table of yours. Can’t say that I care for your hospitality.
You wouldn’t even be conscious if it wasn’t necessary for the memory sifter to work.
Memory sifter? Don’t tell me. Some kind of a mind probe?
Don’t try to resist, it will only cause you unnecessary pain.
FX: DEVICE SWITCHED ON
(IN PAIN BUT RESISTING) That’s... what... they all say...
FX: BUTTONS PRESSED
Stimulating memnonic pathways. Activating neural imager. (BEAT) Don’t worry. I don’t want to see your whole life
story. Just enough to ascertain who you are.
You... could... always... ask!
FX: BUTTONS PRESSED
THE SHADOW HEART — by Jonathan Morris Page 21
Not reliable enough, I’m afraid. Begin search. All memories containing item Prince Kylo of the Sorsha.
Never... heard... of him!
(FX: MACHINE PLAYS BACK MIXTURE OF SOUND EFFECTS AND VOICES FROM ‘THE BURNING PRINCE’ WITH A CLEAR LINE OF DIALOGUE FROM THE YOUNG KYLO)
Then who’s that I see with him on the surface of Sharnax?
(SOUND EFFECTS AND VOICES FROM THE ORPHEUS PULSE, A CLEAR LINE FROM CHENT)
Or here in the skies of Cawdor? Your mind has betrayed you Doctor. Correlating memories with assignment crystal.
FX: BUTTONS PRESSED. MACHINE STOPS, ANOTHER ACTIVATES
Oh, I see. This is all for the benefit of the crystal.
(VOICE OF CRYSTAL, DISTORT) Memories correspond with those in validation matrix. Identity confirmed - it is the Doctor!
Excellent. So it really is you. The most wanted man in the twelve constellations.
FX: CRYSTAL PLAYS BACK RECORDED MESSAGE
(VIA CRYSTAL)

If you are hearing this message that means you have the Doctor in your custody. In order to receive your reward of ten thousand credits, he must be brought to me alive at the following co-ordinates. Nine-zero, nine-one, elliptic twelve, eight-eight nine-zero nine-zero seven three five...
(OVER END OF PREVIOUS LINE) Of course. The planet Thargross.
What?
Those co-ordinates. They’re for the planet Thargross.
THE SHADOW HEART — by Jonathan Morris Page 22
How could you possibly know that?
That’s why I’ve come looking for you.
FX: MACHINE PLAYS BACK LINE FROM SCENE 52
(PLAYBACK) Of course. Don’t you remember, Doctor? You showed me. You showed me your memory of me meeting you here, now.
FX: PLAYBACK FADES OUT
What was that?
A memory.
But I’ve never met you before —
It’s not a memory of the past. It’s a memory of the future.
THE SHADOW HEART — by Jonathan Morris Page 23
7. INT. CORRIDOR.
FX: ROBOT CLEANER WHIRRS BY
(WAKING) Oh my head. Whatever I had to drink last night, I hope it was worth it. Horval! Horval, wake up!
(WAKING) Wha- what? Oh great-creator. I haven’t felt this bad since the morning after Apocalypto’s stag. (BEAT) Hey, what are we doing here? Must’ve passed out in the corridor.
Don’t you remember? The Doctor said someone was pumping sleeping gas into the building.
Oh, right. (REMEMBERS) The Doctor!
Come on, get up, you’re making the floor look untidy.
HELPS HORVAL UP
(BEING HELPED UP) Door’s still open —
FX: THEY ENTER, FEET CRUNCHING ON GLASS
Oh, all the windows have been smashed, they’d better not put this on our bill!
Must be how the gas dispersed. And it’s daylight out there. Must’ve been asleep for hours.
No sign of the Doctor.
No. But don’t worry. We’1ll get him back.
We will? How?
When I made him that covey, I slipped him a tracking bug. Just in case he went walkabout. All we have to do is home in on the signal and Pob’s your monkey.
THE SHADOW HEART — by Jonathan Morris Page 24
You think of everything, Talbar!
As the old saying goes, “he who prepares, wins”.
THE SHADOW HEART — by Jonathan Morris Page 25
8. INT. VIENNA’S SPACESHIP’S LIVING QUARTERS.
How can you have a memory of the future?
It’s a long story - and one I’m not going to tell you.
Oh, you will tell me Doctor. Eventually. Begin search. All memories containing item Vienna Salvatori.
FX: BUTTONS PRESSED. MACHINE PLAYS BACK
(PLAYBACK) All memories containing item Vienna Salvatori.
Not now, you fool, earlier. Show earliest memory.
FX: BUTTONS PRESSED. MACHINE PLAYS BACK FROM SCENE 5
(PLAYBACK) Move towards the window. That’s it. One more step.
You see, I can control which of my memories your little gadget has access to. I only let you see my memories of Kylo because I wanted to find something out.
FX: BUTTONS PRESSED. MACHINE DEACTIVATES
Find what out?
Who you’re really working for. Because if you were working for Kylo Sorsha we would already be on our way to collect the reward.
You’re very clever, Doctor. Which, in my experience, tends to dramatically shorten one’s life expectancy.
FX: SHE LEAVES HIM, DOOR CLOSING AFTER HER
You could at least let me out of these straps! (BEAT) Oh, well. I suppose it’s good for my posture.
THE SHADOW HEART — by Jonathan Morris Page 26
9. INT. VIENNA’S SPACESHIP’S COCKPIT.
FX: DOOR CLOSES, VIENNA SITS AND ACCESSES COMMUNICATOR

This is agent code xenon on encryption key-code alpha. I have located the Doctor, repeat, have located the Doctor. The assignment crystal has released the co-ordinates of Kylo’s location. I will provide them, in return for the agreed payment.
(FX: WRATH LEADER REPLIES. HE HAS A DEEPER VOICE THAN
WRATH; THEY ARE ROBOTIZED IGRIS, GROWLING,
VOICES)
(VIA RADIO) You are to remain on Temperance and await the arrival of the Wrath justice fleet.
THE SHADOW HEART — by Jonathan Morris Page 27
10. INT. VIENNA’S SPACESHIP’S LIVING QUARTERS.
(THINKING ALOUD TO HIMSELF) So... she brought me here so that the assignment crystal could verify my identity, and give her the details of Kylo’s whereabouts...
FX: EXTERIOR DOOR OPENS
(LOUD WHISPER) There, I told you I could open it. These d-class fighters are all the same. Quick, Horval, inside!
Why does it have to be me? I thought this bounty hunter was a psychopath.
Because, Horval, that’s what I pay you for!
Oh yeah, I forgot, terrific. (BEAT, LOUD WHISPER) Doctor, are you in there?
Horval! At last! I suggest you press the first switch on the left of the control unit —
First switch, got you.
FX: BUTTON PRESSED. STRAPS RELEASED
That’s better, can sit up now. (DOES SO)
You don’t need me to carry you or nothing?
Of course not, I’m as fit as a Stradivarius!
FX: DOCTOR JUMPS DOWN FROM TABLE
Alright, Doctor, whatever you say...
FX: THEY LEAVE
THE SHADOW HEART — by Jonathan Morris Page 28
11. EXT. SPACEPORT
(FX: DOCTOR, TALBAR AND HORVAL HURRYING THROUGH

SPACEPORT. SHIPS TAKING OFF AND LANDING IN B/G, ALONG WITH CHATTER AND ANNOUNCEMENTS IN ALIEN TONGUES, LIKE ARABIC, RUSSIAN AND GREEK. ALIEN LIVESTOCK, CHICKENS. LIKE A NORTH AFRICAN PORT DURING 40S, CASABLANCA-ISH! )
Doctor! Still in one piece, I see!
Yes, I was wondering how long it would take until you found me.
What?
You don’t seriously believe I didn’t notice that tracking bug you slipped in my covey?
So you drank it, knowing —
Knowing that it would help you find me in the event my being kidnapped, yes.
You were expecting us to come and rescue you?
Well, I am worth ten thousand credits.
How much?
Come on. We have to get out of here.
Hercules!
What?
